Brain.ParietalLobe

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • Brain.ParietalLobe.Shape
      • Brain.ParietalLobe.Square

  • public class Square
extends Shape
    Represents a 2D square.
    Version:
    5/15/2017
    Author:
    Thanh Luong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Square(double xCoord, double yCoord, double length, java.awt.Color c)
      Constructs a new instance of this square.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Moves this square to the left by decreasing its x-coordinate by a certain velocity.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws an instance of this square.
      double getHeight() 
      void moveWithWall(int a)
      Moves this circle with the wall by increasing or decreasing its y-coordinate, depending on the arrow key pressed.
      int whichShape()
      Returns an integer determining the shape this is, out of a circle, square, or triangle depending on its order in the main array (constructed in the ParietalPanel class)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Square

        public Square(double xCoord,
              double yCoord,
              double length,
              java.awt.Color c)
        Constructs a new instance of this square.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - the x-coordinate of the top left corner of the square
        yCoord - the y-coordinate of the top left corner of the square
        length - the side length of the square
        c - the color of this circle

        Moves this square to the left by decreasing its x-coordinate by a certain velocity.

      • moveWithWall

        public void moveWithWall(int a)
        Moves this circle with the wall by increasing or decreasing its y-coordinate, depending on the arrow key pressed.
        Specified by:
        moveWithWall in class Shape
        Parameters:
        a - the integer that determines which arrow key is being pressed, a > 0 if the up arrow key is pressed and a < 0 if the down arrow key is pressed

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Specified by:
        getHeight in class Shape

      • whichShape

        public int whichShape()
        Returns an integer determining the shape this is, out of a circle, square, or triangle depending on its order in the main array (constructed in the ParietalPanel class)
        Specified by:
        whichShape in class Shape
        Returns:
        the integer 2 since this is a square and is the second index in the main array
